title: Quid Pro Quo Sexual Harassment

paraText: Quid pro quo (Latin for “this for that”) harassment occurs when a person in a position of authority, usually a supervisor or manager, requires employees to tolerate inappropriate behavior that is sexual in nature as a condition of obtaining or keeping a job or a job benefit, including raises and promotions
Some examples of quid pro quo harassment are:

list: “You can have that promotion if you accompany me to dinner”
“To get ahead in this company you should wear more revealing clothes”
“If you don’t kiss me, you will never get promoted”
